section.title: Repository
section.para: Ubuntu uses an "apt" based repository system. On the command line you can use the "apt-get" tool.

In order to add the Eclipse NeoSCADA repository to your system create a file called /etc/apt/sources.d/eclipse-scada.list with the following content: deb http://download.eclipse.org/eclipsescada/repos/release/0.3/apt/ default main

For enabling additions of the openSCADA project create a second file, called /etc/apt/sources.d/openscada.list with the following content: deb http://thedrone.packagedrone.org/apt/openscada-1.4/ default main

If you also plan on using the ICMP Ping Helper application, you will need to install if from the Ubuntu Launchpad platform. Add the repository by executing the following command as root: add-apt-repository ppa:eclipsescada/ppa
Refresh the apt cache: apt-get update

Executing the following command will give verify if adding the repository was successful: apt-cache search "org.eclipse.scada" If should print out a list of packages: org.eclipse.scada.p2 - Eclipse NeoSCADA base P2 package org.eclipse.scada.configuration - Eclipse NeoSCADA base configuration package org.eclipse.scada - Eclipse NeoSCADA base package org.eclipse.scada.deploy.p2director-incubation - Eclipse NeoSCADA P2 Director
